intro: Pseudonoseris glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular pseudonoseris, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open grasslands. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring and summer. The leaves are usually hairy and glandular, giving the plant its scientific name.
